data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Today’s workout is all about quality and consistency. We’ll be doing **6 rounds** of a mix of cardio and strength movements, which will help improve your endurance, coordination, and overall strength. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each round while keeping a steady pace. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the reps; it’s about doing them well!


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

**Technique Steps:**

  • **Rowing:**
  • Start seated on the rower with your feet secured in the foot straps.
  • Grip the handle with both hands, keeping your arms straight and your back tall.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly at the hips, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the movement by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees.

  • **Ski Erg:**
  • Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, gripping the handles.
  • Engage your core and pull the handles down towards your hips while driving your knees slightly forward.
  • Return to the starting position with control, maintaining a steady rhythm.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders.
  • Use your legs to generate power, not just your arms.
  • Maintain a consistent pace throughout the 3 minutes.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • If you’re new to rowing, aim for a lower intensity or shorter duration (e.g., 2 minutes).
  • For Ski Erg, reduce the resistance or switch to a rower if needed.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel to lift your body up.
  • Bring the other foot up to meet the first on the box, then step back down one foot at a time.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement.
  • Ensure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping.
  • Alternate the leading foot each round to balance the workload.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height.
  • If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a bench.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out.
  • Place the kettlebell between your feet and hinge at the hips to grab it with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin while keeping your elbows high.
  • Lower the kettlebell back down with control.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your back flat and engage your core during the lift.
  • Focus on using your legs to initiate the movement, not just your arms.
  • Ensure the kettlebell stays close to your body as you pull it up.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • Use a lighter kettlebell if you’re new to this movement.
  • If kettlebells are not available, you can substitute with dumbbells or perform a sumo deadlift without the high pull.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

    **Technique Steps:**

  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back comfortably.
  • Grab the rings with an overhand grip and walk your feet forward until your body is at an angle.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  • Lower yourself back down with control.

    • **Form Tips:**

  • Keep your body straight from head to heels; avoid sagging your hips.
  • Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms.
  • Adjust your foot position to increase or decrease the difficulty.

    • **Scaling/Modifications:**

  • If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows on a barbell or use a TRX.
  • For beginners, elevate your feet or use a lower angle to make it easier.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski Erg: 2 minutes
  • Box Step-Ups: 16/8 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 16/8 kg
  • Ring Rows: 8 reps

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski Erg: 3 minutes
  • Box Step-Ups: 20 reps on a 20/12 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 20/12 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski Erg: 3 minutes
  • Box Step-Ups: 20 reps on a 24/16 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 24/16 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go slower and maintain good form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and box step-ups.
  • Stay hydrated and listen to your body. If you feel fatigued, take a moment to breathe and reset before continuing.

    • Alright team, let’s get after it! Remember, quality over quantity. Keep your form tight, and let’s have some fun!

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

  • Kettlebell: 20/12 kg

  • Kettlebell: 24/16 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

--- AI EXPLANATION --- ## Workout Overview Hey everyone! Today’s workout is all about quality and consistency. We’ll be doing **6 rounds** of a mix of cardio and strength movements, which will help improve your endurance, coordination, and overall strength. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each round while keeping a steady pace. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the reps; it’s about doing them well! ## Workout Components ### 1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00) **Technique Steps:** - **Rowing:** - Start seated on the rower with your feet secured in the foot straps. - Grip the handle with both hands, keeping your arms straight and your back tall. - Push through your legs, lean back slightly at the hips, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close. - Reverse the movement by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees. - **Ski Erg:** - Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, gripping the handles. - Engage your core and pull the handles down towards your hips while driving your knees slightly forward. - Return to the starting position with control, maintaining a steady rhythm. **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders. - Use your legs to generate power, not just your arms. - Maintain a consistent pace throughout the 3 minutes. **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you’re new to rowing, aim for a lower intensity or shorter duration (e.g., 2 minutes). - For Ski Erg, reduce the resistance or switch to a rower if needed. ### 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps) **Technique Steps:** - Stand facing the box with feet hip-width apart. - Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel to lift your body up. - Bring the other foot up to meet the first on the box, then step back down one foot at a time. **Form Tips:** - Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement. - Ensure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping. - Alternate the leading foot each round to balance the workload. **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height. - If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a bench. ### 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps) **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out. - Place the kettlebell between your feet and hinge at the hips to grab it with both hands. - Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin while keeping your elbows high. - Lower the kettlebell back down with control. **Form Tips:** - Keep your back flat and engage your core during the lift. - Focus on using your legs to initiate the movement, not just your arms. - Ensure the kettlebell stays close to your body as you pull it up. **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell if you’re new to this movement. - If kettlebells are not available, you can substitute with dumbbells or perform a sumo deadlift without the high pull. ### 4. Ring Rows (10 reps) **Technique Steps:** - Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back comfortably. - Grab the rings with an overhand grip and walk your feet forward until your body is at an angle. - Pull your chest towards the rings by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together. - Lower yourself back down with control. **Form Tips:** - Keep your body straight from head to heels; avoid sagging your hips. - Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms. - Adjust your foot position to increase or decrease the difficulty. **Scaling/Modifications:** - If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows on a barbell or use a TRX. - For beginners, elevate your feet or use a lower angle to make it easier. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - Row/Ski Erg: 2 minutes - Box Step-Ups: 16/8 inch box - Kettlebell: 16/8 kg - Ring Rows: 8 reps - **Train:** - Row/Ski Erg: 3 minutes - Box Step-Ups: 20 reps on a 20/12 inch box - Kettlebell: 20/12 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps - **Compete:** - Row/Ski Erg: 3 minutes - Box Step-Ups: 20 reps on a 24/16 inch box - Kettlebell: 24/16 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps ### Strategy Advice - Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go slower and maintain good form than to rush and risk injury. - Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and box step-ups. - Stay hydrated and listen to your body. If you feel fatigued, take a moment to breathe and reset before continuing. Alright team, let’s get after it! Remember, quality over quantity. Keep your form tight, and let’s have some fun!
